edu.asu.ying.mapreduce.table

Class Page

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>
        • edu.asu.ying.mapreduce.table.Page
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Distributable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>, java.util.Map<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>

    public final class Page
extends java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>
implements Distributable, java.io.Serializable
    Contains a single page of WritableValue elements from a ClientTable. Pages are the unit of exchange of data across the DHT network, and are the input types for map and reduce operations. A single page therefore contains all of the data that will be processed by a single node during a map operation, though a node can be responsible for multiple pages.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • onPageFull

        public final transient Event onPageFull
        Fired once when the page first reaches its maximum capacity.

        Further attempts to add elements after this has fired will throw an exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Page

        public Page(ClientTable table,
    int index,
    int maxSize)
        Initialize a blank page from a table's parameters.
        Parameters:
        table - the parent table holding this page.
        index - the index of this page on its parent table.
        maxSize - the capacity of this table at which it will fire onPageFull
